[["Welcome to ",{"text":"Nadir","color":"dark_purple","bold":true},"! ",{"text":"‚ù§","color":"#731992"},"\n\n",{"text":"Nadir ","color":"dark_purple"},"is a datapack that expands how enchanting works by ",{"text":"rebalancing most vanilla enchantments","italic":true},", ",{"text":"adding some new ones","italic":true},", and most importantly - ",{"text":"reworking the Enchanting Table","italic":true},"."]]

[["This book will serve as a ",{"text":"comprehensive guide to everything the pack adds or changes","italic":true},". Just in case you forget and don't want to check the pack's project page.\n\nIf you ever lose it, you can always craft it again by fusing any ",{"text":"Enchanted Book","color":"#ff33cc","bold":true,"hover_event":{"action":"show_item","id":"minecraft:enchanted_book"}}," with ",{"text":"Blaze Powder","color":"#ff9900","bold":true,"hover_event":{"action":"show_item","id":"minecraft:blaze_powder"}},"."]]

[["",{"text":" Enchanting Table ","bold":true,"underlined":true}," 

Nadir reinvents the way the Enchanting Table is interacted with.

First off, ",{"text":"there is no GUI for enchanting","color":"dark_red","italic":true},". Instead, interacting with a Table will ",{"text":"bring up a small menu","italic":true},"."]]

[["In it you can then either choose to proceed to ",{"text":"enchanting","color":"#d37cff"},", or ",{"text":"dismantle ","color":"#d02b2b"},"the Table.\n\nOnly the ",{"text":"player who placed the Table","underlined":true}," can dismantle it."]]

[["Should you choose the '",{"text":"Enchant","color":"#d37cff"},"' option, the menu will change shortly after.\n\nThe 4 numbers at the top stand for ",{"text":"Eterna","color":"#3aff4a","bold":true},", ",{"text":"Quanta","color":"#f94242","bold":true},", ",{"text":"Arcana","color":"#dc66ff","bold":true}," and ",{"text":"Rectification","color":"#ffed89","bold":true},{"text":" ","bold":true},"respectively. ",{"text":"All of them have an effect on the Table's outcome","italic":true},"."]]

[["All 4 variables can be modified by ",{"text":"placing different blocks","italic":true}," around the Enchanting Table.\n\nTable's block detection range has also been increased upwards by 1 block, ",{"text":"making it 5x5x3","italic":true},"."]]

[["      ",{"text":" Variables ","bold":true,"underlined":true},"

",{"text":"Eterna","color":"#3aff4a"}," is the most basic force, representing the Table's ",{"text":"raw enchanting power","italic":true},".

15 Eterna allows for enchanting at level 30.
",{"text":" Max value:","bold":true,"underlined":true},{"text":" 30 ","underlined":true},"

[["",{"text":"Quanta ","color":"#f94242"},"is the chaos factor, ",{"text":"amplifying the enchanting level by +- half of its value","italic":true},".

50% Quanta can amplify enchanting level by ",{"text":"-25% ","color":"red"},{"text":"~","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":" ","color":"red"},{"text":"25%","color":"green"},".
",{"text":" Max value:","bold":true,"underlined":true},{"text":" 100% ","underlined":true},"

[["",{"text":"Arcana","color":"#dc66ff"}," is a force of purity, giving the Table chance to roll enchantments twice.

40% Arcana would give the Table a 40% chance to do so.

[["",{"text":"Rectification","color":"#ffed89"}," is a calming force, which reduces ",{"text":"Quanta","color":"#f94242"},"'s negative influence.

50% Rectification and 100% Quanta would mean that the amplification potential is ",{"text":"-25%","color":"red"}," ",{"text":"~ ","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":"50%","color":"green"},".
",{"text":" Max value:","bold":true,"underlined":true},{"text":" 100% ","underlined":true},"

[["",{"text":" ‚Ä¢ ","color":"gray"},{"text":"Sharpness","color":"#33ccff","hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":["Can be applied to ",{"text":"Tridents ","color":"aqua"},"and ",{"text":"Maces","color":"gray"},"."]}},"

Both enchantments can be applied to ",{"text":"Tridents ","color":"aqua"},"and ",{"text":"Maces","color":"gray"},"."]}},"
",{"text":" ‚Ä¢ ","color":"gray"},{"text":"Sweeping Edge","color":"#33ccff","hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":["",{"text":"Reduced efficiency","color":"red"},"."]}},"
",{"text":" ‚Ä¢ ","color":"gray"},{"text":"Protection","color":"#33ccff","hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":["Reduced base damage reduction per level from ",{"text":"+4%","color":"yellow"}," to ",{"text":"+2.5%","color":"red"},".

",{"text":"This means that maximum damage reduction is now ","color":"gray"},{"text":"50% with full Protection V","color":"dark_red"},{"text":" armor, versus 64% with full Protection IV in vanilla.","color":"gray"}]}},"
",{"text":" ‚Ä¢ ","color":"gray"},{"text":"Special Protections","color":"#33ccff","hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":["Stack with ",{"text":"each other","color":"green"}," and ",{"text":"Protection ","color":"green"},"itself.

",{"text":"Blast Protection","color":"gold"}," gives ",{"text":"+5%","color":"red"}," knockback resistance per level compared to vanilla's ",{"text":"15%","color":"yellow"},".
",{"text":"Fire Protection","color":"gold"}," reduces burn time by ",{"text":"[","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":"-10% + 5% * level","color":"gray"},{"text":"]","color":"dark_gray"},", stacking ",{"text":"multiplicatively ","color":"green"},"instead of ",{"text":"additively","color":"yellow"},".

",{"text":"This means that each specialized Protection enchantment can provide an extra ","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":"48% damage reduction","color":"dark_red"},{"text":" against a given damage type, while in vanilla it is 80%.","color":"dark_gray"}]}},"
",{"text":" ‚Ä¢ ","color":"gray"},{"text":"Feather Falling","color":"#33ccff","hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":["Reworked to reduce taken fall damage by ",{"text":"[","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":"5% * (level + 1)","color":"gray"},{"text":"]","color":"dark_gray"}," and increase safe fall distance by ",{"text":"[","color":"dark_gray"},{"text":"1 + level * 2","color":"gray"},{"text":"]","color":"dark_gray"}," blocks."]}},"

",{"text":"It's also a lot easier to get in the Enchanting Table than other enchantments, only requiring a minimum level of 5. [["    ",{"text":" ","bold":true,"underlined":true},{"text":"Repair Cost ","bold":true,"underlined":true},"

By default, ",{"text":"Nadir removes Anvil repair costs completely","italic":true},". This allows for a lot more flexibility with applying enchantments.

It also allows for ",{"text":"renaming ","italic":true},"and ",{"text":"repairing heavily enchanted items","italic":true},"."]]

[["This can be",{"text":" ","italic":true},{"text":"disabled","italic":true,"color":"red","click_event":{"action":"copy_to_clipboard","value":"scoreboard players set #nadir.config nadir.config.remove_repair_cost 0"},"hover_event":{"action":"show_text","value":"Click to copy 'disable' command to clipboard"}}," and then all repair costs will follow the default behavior. It is ",{"text":"not recommended","underlined":true}," due to how quickly vanilla's cap can become a problem."]]
